nodes.title: I.1. Residential Structures Occupying Summits: Fortresses, breastworks, religious buildings, palaces, and related edifices
Buddhist ruins
nodes.body: In the escarpments surrounding the Pangtra ChuSpang bkra chu there are at least two cave complexes that were used by Buddhist practitioners. Near the contemporary settlement of spangs khra there are around 100 caves at DzongkarRdzong dkar, on the right side of the valley (see B-121). Reportedly, a few of the caves contain Buddhist frescos. The site known as Black Acme Meditation House (Naktsuk Tsamkhangnag gtsug mtshams khang), located above Black Acme Castle, hosts about 12 caves and significant evidence of Buddhist occupation such as discarded folios, a ruined a type of shrine and tsa tsatsha sha figurines.
